metadata.Title: CVE-2023-38650 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description: Multiple integer overflow vulnerabilities exist in the VZTvzt_rd_block_vch_decode times parsing functionality of GTKWave 3.3.115. Aspecially crafted .vzt file can lead to memory corruption. A victim wouldneed to open a malicious file to trigger these vulnerabilities.Thisvulnerability concerns the integer overflow when num_time_ticks is notzero.

criterions.comment: gtkwave: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
